title: Grade 11 - Technological Design and the Environment TDJ3O (2009)
subject: Technological Education

document.title: Grade 11 - Technological Design and the Environment TDJ3O (2009)

B5FE9145DDE4411789F90ABC6E9BB13E.description: maintain an up-to-date portfolio that includes pieces of work and other materials that provide evidence of their skills and achievements in technological design (e.g., work logs, skills checklist, sketches, drawings, photographs of models and prototypes, virtual models), and explain why having a current portfolio is important for career development and advancement.

33376EB0034F48CF926BFA480D626C09.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the work habits that are important for success in the technological design industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., working safely, teamwork, reliability, initiative, customer service, entrepreneurship);

BC7F7DDC0DE54BC399F42D0A6B37E1E7.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the Essential Skills that are important for success in the technological design industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., reading text, writing, document use, measurement and calculation);

BF5CA9CA9D5041B6B65C340070BC4940.description: identify groups and programs that are available to support students who are interested in pursuing non-traditional career choices in the technological design industry (e.g., mentoring programs, virtual networking/support groups, specialized postsecondary programs, relevant trade/industry associations);

7DF8E51E7A6B44B6908BCFA7512227CB.description: identify education and training requirements (e.g., degree, diploma, certificate, apprenticeship) for specific careers related to technological design;

C073CDEA67EE493AB4C4A51FEE95FFBC.description: identify a variety of career opportunities related to technological design (e.g., civil engineer, architect, mechanical engineering technician, environmental technologist, landscape designer, fashion designer, interior designer)

949D97B8F9D54C7B90E21BFB3CC4BCAC.description: Career Opportunities: identify careers related to technological design, and describe the training and education required for these careers.

077F3231D7714667AB17EE526F05B38D.description: use protective clothing, gear, and equipment appropriately (e.g., dust mask, safety glasses).

6FE8DFA394224E008618DF7EDB3C5C8F.description: demonstrate an understanding of and follow personal and environmental health and safety procedures with respect to processes, materials, tools, equipment, and facilities throughout the design process and when performing related activities (e.g., use protective equipment; set tool and equipment guards properly; ensure adequate ventilation and ergonomic seating and other workplace arrangements; follow safe operating procedures; keep work areas clean and organized; store materials and dispose of wastes properly);

2471EE05DBF3485385A3CA0B5271895B.description: investigate and describe health, safety, and environmental laws, regulations, standards, and agencies that can affect technological design (e.g., Ontario Environmental Bill of Rights, Clean Water Act, Canadian Standards Association [CSA] standards, Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System [WHMIS]);

56DD426AB6144E4AAC4A9A44053D85B4.description: Health and Safety: describe and apply appropriate health, safety, and environmental practices and standards throughout the design process;

E3AC87E2E39941818E3240F65CBD6C64.description: describe how technological design has benefited society (e.g., prosthetic limbs, on-demand water heaters, catalytic converters, nanotechnology, wireless communication, air purifiers).

D01449FD183F4F168A0CE452D3ECB75D.description: research and report on how society influences technology (e.g., higher energy costs spur development of more efficient vehicles, increasing population density leads to the construction of taller buildings, environmental awareness leads to development of alternative energy sources);

503238F83FBD465199054E6A5B798F8C.description: Technology and Society: describe how society influences technological innovation and how technology affects society.

8A2D86FADC0D4861B7305A57769B5E21.description: compare the environmental impact of various products that are used for the same purpose (e.g., plastic bags versus paper bags or reusable cloth bags, paper cups versus polystyrene foam cups).

385565A614374BE6B2D5229F2921151D.description: describe innovative technological designs (e.g., alternative energy sources, more efficient automobiles, ways of reducing manufacturing waste) that were developed in response to changes in the environment (e.g., global warming, pollution, rainforest destruction);

521B75C0F2584600985C9D8C9F7A59AA.description: research and report on organizations and/or community partners that foster environmentally friendly design practices (e.g., Ontario Centre for Environmental Technology Advancement, other Canadian environmental technology advancement centres);

D91E72DEA6F24EBCB2577D6FD1CF0E0E.description: describe and apply best practices for conserving energy and other resources when designing a product or process (e.g., reuse or recycle materials, use wood glue instead of hot glue, use energy management systems for computers);

75EA2212180842AFA57ED7953FFBA457.description: identify environmental issues that affect technological design (e.g., pollution, greenhouse gases, resource use, ozone depletion);

439B825BFA264E3F896CA0846248FA25.description: Technology and the Environment: demonstrate an understanding of environmentally responsible design practices and strategies, and apply them in the technological design process and related activities;

751EC3D706C5473DAD2907CAAED68C70.description: report and reflect on the decisions they made and their experiences throughout the design process, using appropriate written and/or oral formats.

0405F18C39C44A8B9C2F3EBB9A4F27F1.description: present a report summarizing the design choices, progress, and results of the design project, with an emphasis on how the design deals with environmental concerns, using a variety of tools (e.g., presentation software, interactive white board, web pages, word-processing software);

BB8D2DEA81C54BC5818D65D349FEAE6B.description: Reporting and Presenting: report on the progress, environmental rationale, and results of the design process, using appropriate formats and styles.

323D9B31C29F4BC6AB1C30C8868E16BD.description: test models and/or prototypes, and evaluate designs using student-generated criteria (e.g., by-products, waste, energy consumption, biodegradability, reliability, durability).

1D85DB9217384284B30DABFA0FA55A8E.description: use appropriate metric and imperial measuring tools, scales (e.g., metric: 1:10, 1 cm:1 m or 1:100, 1:500; imperial: 1 /2":1' or 1:24), and proportion techniques when creating a model or prototype;

461A85C8264E48E4B238A9E5D1B86958.description: use appropriate tools, equipment, and materials to create design models and prototypes (e.g., tools: rotary tool, bandsaw, fabric shears, computer-aided design [CAD] software; equipment: computer, sewing machine; materials: paper, wax, clay, wood, metals, composites, plastics, cardboard, starch, textiles);

3780E15919094075988C8F040CD29F1A.description: Making and Testing Models and Prototypes: construct models and prototypes using a variety of techniques, tools, and materials, and assess these models and prototypes in terms of the design criteria;

FD6F73B948D843528F879170B3FDD032.description: produce hand-drafted and/or computerbased technical drawings (e.g., elevation, plan, schematic, exploded view) of design solutions, using common drafting standards and conventions (e.g., format, line type and weight, symbols).

7A3A7BC2E42A4B079022236F25FC14E5.description: apply mathematical and scientific concepts and skills as required in the course of designing various products and/or processes;

7A0F9D513DE543FC821262C6B539D85B.description: create freehand sketches showing key features (e.g., shapes, texture, protrusions, unusual features, relationships among parts) to help develop initial concepts for a design project;

2D36F8E53D0D409CBBE1B77651CBE84A.description: Developing and Representing Design Ideas: apply appropriate methods for generating and graphically representing design ideas and solutions;

3712AB858C4143B3BBF6664C37610DD8.description: select and apply effective planning and organizational tools and strategies (e.g., sequence chart, time sheet, swatch book, checklists, file management) to develop environmentally sound design projects.

87C127EAE90D4ED291C7A7BD18D5B12B.description: investigate and describe economic and environmental factors that should be considered during the design process;

2C231178CED34E39996FF62C207F0399.description: gather and summarize relevant information for developing various designs (e.g., Canadian Standards Association [CSA] publications, Ontario Building Code, environmental criteria);

4AFF4C8380024F42AE9D4786AC282410.description: Research, Planning, and Organization: use appropriate tools and strategies to research, plan, and organize design projects that have environmentally sound designs and production processes;

96A6DD1317464E41A232D5CA5080C39F.description: choose the most effective method to communicate progress and results for a given project from a variety of presentation tools and strategies (e.g., LCD projector, display board, oral or written presentation)

634A6C1BE2FC4C3F9276C551161A0C2C.description: describe how various report formats can be used to record design ideas and document the progress of a design project (e.g., portfolio, journal, logbook, sketchbook);

9D4857A76C1C47AAA797B3AFB8F6DFB2.description: demonstrate an understanding of technical and environmental terminology used in the design process (e.g., drafting versus drawing, scale versus ruler, greenhouse gases, parts per billion, fossil fuel);

771FFA5049A242369E01A0E53C34FBFA.description: Reporting and Presenting: demonstrate an understanding of the technical and environmental terminology and the communication methods and formats used in the design process

6EFA2AFF99E44922A63D3C56DC259A1A.description: identify equipment (e.g., decibel meter, height gauge, weighing scale, colour wheel) and methods (e.g., measuring dimensions, compression testing, wind tunnel testing) used for assessing prototypes.

C0DD7086D69943D4B925C0A7326AD1B6.description: identify criteria for assessing the environmental friendliness of a design and of the processes required to produce it (e.g., byproducts, waste, energy consumption, reuse and/or recycling of materials, biodegradability);

55894B220BF348B7BA950A8714AF6DA4.description: identify criteria for assessing designs (e.g., adherence to specifications, effectiveness, cost, durability, appearance);

9E0C68ACF55248009424A3C328641E6B.description: compare various kinds of models (e.g., conceptual, physical, virtual, theoretical) and prototypes (e.g., proof-of-principle, functional, form study), taking into account the tools and materials required to produce them (e.g., tools: cut out patterns, animation; materials: paper, wax, clay, wood, metals, composites, plastics, cardboard, starch, textiles), as well as the amount of energy used and the wastes produced;

A44E4408EADB42C39D8C9131FFB3CD0A.description: Making and Testing Models and Prototypes: compare various kinds of models and prototypes and identify criteria, equipment, and methods for assessing them

6377234AE07D46379BFD26C3A9AA0F95.description: identify and describe various types of technical drawings (e.g., 2D and 3D drawings, floor plans, elevations, sections, detail and rendered drawings) and the drafting standards and conventions used in them (e.g., symbols, abbreviations, line types).

8F4A6084D0F34E1BA36F577239F1F999.description: compare different methods for representing design ideas graphically (e.g., mind maps, sketches, computer-aided drawings);

2C15A2EE15924E9391821EDFF283CBFD.description: Representing Design Ideas Graphically: demonstrate an understanding of drafting standards, conventions, and guidelines for representing design ideas graphically

802307056D3F4D0AAC3106FE3FDA8F9B.description: plan ways to apply the principles of sustainability and minimize environmental harm throughout the design process for a project (e.g., plan to use recycled materials, limit the use of energy-consuming equipment).

858C133713D74EC4B0869CD98C13AF6D.description: describe strategies and tools for planning and organizing a design project;

6D652C384AB9446EA0BA559BF0355A83.description: identify and apply strategies for gathering information from various sources (e.g., books, Ministry of the Environment website, interview with a naturalist) for a design project that meets an environmental need;

C2A19AFE1EC24EFBB2AFB8F6AA9F3356.description: describe the relationship between various steps of the design process (e.g., testing a model or prototype, and then incorporating improvements or redesigning and retesting if necessary).

C5EBB7B8CD244F95B79F55B31D42C0A6.description: identify and describe the steps in the design process (e.g., define the problem or challenge, taking into account relevant contextual or background information; gather information about criteria, constraints, and available materials; generate possible solutions, using techniques such as brainstorming; choose the best solution; develop and produce a model or prototype; test the model or prototype; incorporate improvements or redesign and retest; report results)

6FC05DAF432E4ADAAE48F9B4DB8B9261.description: describe the need for technological designs that take environmental factors into account (e.g., fuel-efficient vehicles, non-toxic paints and pesticides, renewable energy sources, sustainable production of materials);

FA67707DC3FC42708C4FABCE561F5A80.description: describe the purpose of design for a given project (e.g., cleaner energy, reduced carbon footprint, less manufacturing waste) in terms of key technological concepts (e.g., aesthetics, control, environmental sustainability/stewardship, ergonomics, fabrication, function, innovation, material, mechanism, power and energy, structure, safety, systems)

B0E8CD4B057A46BF89DD1C5F4999F064.description: Design Process: describe the design process, and identify ways in which technological design can address an environmental need or challenge;
